org.grails.rabbitmq
[Groovy] Class RabbitServiceConfigurer

java.lang.Object
  org.grails.rabbitmq.RabbitServiceConfigurer

class RabbitServiceConfigurer

Configures the Spring beans required to set up a service as an AMQP listener. The service must have either a static rabbitQueue property declared or a static rabbitSubscribe one (but not both). If neither of these exist, nothing is configured. Otherwise, it will configure a org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer and an associated org.springframework.amqp.rabbit.listener.adapter.MessageListenerAdapter.

Constructor Detail

RabbitServiceConfigurer

RabbitServiceConfigurer(java.lang.Object serviceClass, java.lang.Object rabbitConfig)
Fairly cheap configurer construction. Create new ones as needed. If the given service isn't declared as an AMPQ/Rabbit listener, then the object is successfully created, but isListener() will return false.
Parameters:
serviceClass - The GrailsServiceClass for the service that requires configuration.
rabbitConfig - The Rabbit config, i.e. everthing below 'rabbitmq' in the project's Config.groovy.

 
Method Detail

configure

java.lang.Object configure(java.lang.Object beanBuilder)
Configures the Spring beans required to make the associated Grails service an AMQP listener.
Parameters:
beanBuilder - A BeanBuilder instance through which the required Spring beans will be declared.
